subject: Re: Thanks and more stuff
author: LC Duplatt
full_text:
Perhaps those on the other side are more urgent, anxious and excited 
about the box breakthroughs than even we are.  Could it be because 
they see a bigger picture coming to pass?

- LC


--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "psi_research" <vilhellm@...> wrote:
>
> Hi Ursula,
> 
> There is a certain urgency to Box messages - sort of like they need 
> to convey quickly. The same thing happens in video ITC, it's like 
> there is but a moment and we all better pay attention. -Bill
> 
> --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Ursula Bielski <ursulabielski@> 
> wrote:
> >
> > Willy, Really interested in listening to the new files.  I'll let 
> you know after.
> >   Just to throw in regarding EVP maker and everything else but 
the 
> boxes.  I used EVP maker and the water method AND foreign language 
> broadcast method and radio static and box fan, etc etc etc before I 
> got my shack hack and my Joe's box, and I must admit that I have 
put 
> everything else aside even though I got good results with ALL of 
> those other methods.  There's just something very exciting about 
the 
> boxes, I think, that makes us forsake all others.  When I started 
> using a hack, which Jeff Rezman made for me before I got the Joe's 
> Box, I felt it was a nervous sort of experimentation--that is to 
say, 
> the loud, short, fast sound clips had me on edge, as I was used to 
> quiet static and water, but I think now I'm addicted to the sound 
and 
> the frenzy of it!  Does anyone else feel this way?
> >   Ursula
> > 
> > billliscomb williscomb@ wrote:
> >           Ursula and Misty  thank you very much for your 
feedback. 
> I 
> > really appreciate you taking the time to listen, and for the 
> > comments, especially noting the dual layers of speech. 
Interesting. 
> > Frank S. - Thanks for the recent files from EVPmaker - nice! 
> > There hasn't been much discussion regarding EVPmaker lately, so I 
> > wasn't' sure if it was a viable tool to use. I haven't read many 
> > older posts, but hope to get caught up during the holidays. Have 
> you 
> > or others considered modifying speech synthesis software to 
> generate 
> > random sounds? I wonder how something like that would work
> > On the 16th I did three 3minute recordings and got 9 clips from 
> > them. In this session, I was asking questions regarding a 
knocking 
> > sound I heard while going to sleep or waking up about 12 years 
ago. 
> > My life situation wasn't the best at that time. It was always 
three 
> > knocks, and once a doorbell, but not the doorbell for where I was 
> > then living. Started the Knocking session by telling "Rick" that 
I 
> > got messages from previous session, got "Well, he's got 
patience!" 
> > for response. Then was told, "Aye, it smells in here." Next asked 
> > them what sound did I hear back then, and got "it was knocking 
> (maybe 
> > nothing?)" The best one so far is; "Our earthbound forefathers 
are 
> > video programs." A second voice keeps repeating "Ent" syllable 
> > during this one. I have put these files in a new folder called 
> > Knocking, which is under Laptop MP3s. More comments there. 
> > I'm making progress on getting the software needed to do 
> > linear scanning with the Radio Shark 2 USB am/fm radio and hope 
to 
> > have it up and running within the next week or two. 
> > Thanks again to all
> > Willy
> >
>
